help.title: HELP & RULES
help.setup_content:
• 4 to 8 players (humans and/or bots)
• Each player receives a secret character with a faction (Hunter, Shadow or Neutral)
• Characters have HP and a unique special ability
• All players start at the Hermit's Cabin
• 3 card decks are placed: Hermit, White, Black
help.turn_content:
Each turn has 2 phases:

1. MOVEMENT — Roll the dice (d6+d4) and move to the zone matching the result
2. ACTION — Choose an action:
   • Draw a card from your zone's deck
   • Attack a player in your zone
   • End your turn without action
help.zones_content:
The board has 6 zones:

• Hermit's Cabin — Hermit Deck (vision cards)
• Church — White Deck (healing, protection)
• Cemetery — Black Deck (damage, debuffs)
• Weird Woods — No deck
• Underworld Gate — No deck
• Erstwhile Altar — No deck

Each zone has a number range (2-3, 4-5, 6, 7, 8-9, 10). The dice result directly determines the destination zone.
help.cards_content:
There are 3 types of cards:

• Instant — Effect applied immediately (heal, damage)
• Equipment — Added to your hand, can be equipped for permanent bonuses
• Vision — Guess another player's faction

Equipment cards can be equipped (+damage, +defense) or discarded.
help.combat_content:
To attack:
• You must be in the same zone as your target
• Damage is calculated with a D6 + equipment bonus
• If the target's HP drops to 0, they die
• A dead character is automatically revealed
help.factions_content:
3 factions with different objectives:

• HUNTERS — Win when all Shadows are dead
• SHADOWS — Win when all Hunters are dead
• NEUTRALS — Each has a unique personal objective

Your faction is secret! You can voluntarily reveal to activate certain abilities.
help.abilities_content:
Each character has a unique ability:

• Passive — Activates automatically (e.g. damage reduction)
• Active — Manual activation, sometimes requires being revealed

Some abilities are more powerful once revealed, but revealing your faction gives information to your opponents.
help.save_content:
• Auto-save every 5 major actions
• 3 manual save slots
• Accessible via the pause menu (Escape)
• Load from main menu or pause menu
help.shortcuts_content:
• Escape — Pause menu
• F1 — Help and rules (this menu)
• Hover over any element to see its tooltip
tutorial.step1_text:
This tutorial will guide you through the basic game mechanics.

Shadow Hunter is a board game where Hunters, Shadows and Neutrals fight in the dark. Your identity is secret!
tutorial.step2_text:
The board has 6 zones. Each zone has different properties:

• 3 zones have a card deck (Hermit, White, Black)
• 3 zones have no deck

Zones are connected to each other for movement.
tutorial.step3_text:
Each turn starts with the movement phase.

Click the "Roll Dice" button to determine your movement distance.
tutorial.step4_text:
Accessible zones are now highlighted in yellow.

Click on a highlighted zone to move there. Try to choose a zone with a card deck!
tutorial.step5_text:
After movement, you enter the action phase. You can:

• Draw a card from your zone's deck
• Attack a player in your zone
• End your turn

Click "Draw a card" if a deck is available.
tutorial.step6_text:
There are 3 types of cards:

• Instant — Immediate effect (heal or damage)
• Equipment — Added to your hand, equip for bonuses
• Vision — Guess another player's faction

Equipment cards appear in your hand on the left.
tutorial.step7_text:
To attack, you must be in the same zone as another player.

Damage = D6 + equipment bonus.
If a player's HP drops to 0, they die and their character is revealed.
tutorial.step8_text:
3 factions with different objectives:

• HUNTERS — Eliminate all Shadows
• SHADOWS — Eliminate all Hunters
• NEUTRALS — Unique personal objective

Your faction is secret. You can reveal to activate special abilities.
tutorial.step9_text:
• Escape — Pause menu (save, load)
• F1 — Full help and rules
• Hover over elements to see tooltips

You can replay this tutorial from the main menu at any time.
tutorial.step10_text:
You now know the basics of Shadow Hunter!

Click "Finish" to return to the main menu and start a real game.
